intro: Geonoma gibbosa, commonly known as the hairy fern, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding structure. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are often covered in fine, hairy structures, giving it its common name. Geonoma gibbosa is often found growing in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests.
